title: MusaMohamed
author: MusaMohamed
content: Crypto hacks exploits in 2024.DMM Bitcoin: $300M.WazirX: $230M.Munchabbles: $62M.Dai whale exploit: $55M.Radiant Capital: $51M.BingX: $43M.Penpie: $27M.UwU Lend: $20M.Sonne Finance: $20M.M2 exchange: $14M.DMM Bitcoin, a Centralized Exchange, has a biggest crypto hack in 2024, with total value of hack is $300M. It's a hack on private keys.WazirX, another Centralized Exchange, with a second biggest crypto hack in the last year, total value is $230M. The Lazarus hacker group from North Korea did it.Munchables, a Gaming project: It's $62M hack through a hole in smart contract. You can see danger of smart contract!Dai Whale exploit: It's a personal whale as a victim of phishing attack.Radiant Capital, a Lending project: It was attacked multiple times, and total loss is about $51M.Bing X, another Centralized Exchange: a hack of $43M from hot wallets.Penpie, a Yield Farming project: $27M hack by exploitation on reentrancy hole.UwU Lending, another Lending project: a hack on Oracle flaw.Sonne Finance, a third Lending project in this list: $20M through smart contract hole.The last one is M2 Exchange, another Centralized Exchange, and the fourth CEX in this list, with $14M hack on hot wallets.Again you can see danger of storing your fund on Centralized platforms like Exchanges.Following resources can help you understanding more about most common scams, and practicing better with your money.Reminder: do not keep your money in online accountsSecurity checklist.Scam book.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: There is exchange board on this forum. It is better you move this thread to exchange board which is the perfect board for it.I know only two among the hacks. WazirX and BingX. I do not know of now but when WazirX was hacked, the exchange was unable to pay their customers and the exchange was shutdown at the time. But I know of BingX, the exchange continued to function and their users have access to withdraw. BingX is functioning good till now.But not your key not your coin.

comments.author: headingnorth
comments.body: You would think an advanced country like Japan would have some of the best cyber security, but since Mt. Gox they continue to suffer the worst security breaches in the industry. They have learned nothing.Why would anyone in their right mind leave their bitcoin on a Japanese exchange after so many major incidents? Only an idiot.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: headingnorth on January 02, 2025, 05:51:17 AMWhy would anyone in their right mind leave their bitcoin on a Japanese exchange after so many major incidents? Only an idiot.Fixed that for you.

comments.author: headingnorth
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on January 02, 2025, 06:09:33 AMQuote from: headingnorth on January 02, 2025, 05:51:17 AMWhy would anyone in their right mind leave their bitcoin on a Japanese exchange after so many major incidents? Only an idiot.Fixed that for you.Some exchanges are much better than others. For example Coinbase and Kraken the two oldest exchanges in the world have never been hacked.I wouldn't leave my funds on any exchange, but the reality is many still do because they have no idea about self-custody and will probably never learn.In reality such people are probably more likely to lose their funds by losing their private keys or by mishandling self-custody, so it may be less risky for certain people to leave on the exchange than to self-custody, depending on the quality of the exchange's security. So if you're going to leave your funds on an exchange the least you can do is research its track record and do your due diligence.Millions of bitcoin have been lost forever simply because people lost their private keys or mishandled a self-custody transaction, etc.

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: For the DMM hacked, US and Japan attributed to the state sponsored North Korean hackers,FBI, DC3, and NPA Identification of North Korean Cyber Actors, Tracked as TraderTraitor, Responsible for Theft of $308 Million USD from Bitcoin.DMM.comWe might or might not believed that it was indeed the Lazarus Group who hacked them.But if you have to think about it, North Korea is still under trade embargo and sanction and one way for them to survived is through this hacking on Japanese and South Korean exchanges.

comments.author: fuguebtc
comments.body: Quote from: MusaMohamed on January 02, 2025, 01:54:50 AMAgain you can see danger of storing your fund on Centralized platforms like Exchanges.Storing bitcoins on centralized exchanges exposes us to many risks such as the exchange can freeze assets or go bankrupt...and compensation is very complicated or we even risk losing everything. Overall, there are a lot of risks that we will face if we store bitcoins on centralized platforms but that does not mean that storing bitcoins in personal, non-custodial wallets is completely safe. I believe there are also hundreds of personal, non-custodial wallet hacks happening every year but most go unreported. Therefore, we should also be careful in protecting personal security when using non-custodial wallets, do not be subjective that we will be absolutely safe with it.

comments.body: It is already needless to say this, we have been discussing about this for a very long time now, but still people do not learn and they still leave their funds in custodial services. The mistake a lot of people make is that they believe some services are reputable and so not hackable, but that is not true at all, self custody is the only way to store your coins.
